content.raw:
You should be able to test this with any model that uses contact sensors, e.g. the PR2 gripper. 
I just took a quick look at the ContactSensor.cc code and I think the problem with (ii) might be that you only update the contacts through the OnContact callback so contacts are stored until a new contact occurs. 

Sry for the confusion, the error message above used a modified version of the robonaut model. I'll can look into creating a quick test using gazebo 1.2 tomorrow and attach it (placing a static sphere in the air with a contact sensor attached to its geometry and have another sphere fall on top of it should reproduce the bug if it is still present. The shapes will collide shortly and the contact sensor will still have the contact stored until it collides with another object).
content.html:
You should be able to test this with any model that uses contact sensors, e.g. the PR2 gripper. I just took a quick look at the ContactSensor.cc code and I think the problem with (ii) might be that you only update the contacts through the OnContact callback so contacts are stored until a new contact occurs.

Sry for the confusion, the error message above used a modified version of the robonaut model. I'll can look into creating a quick test using gazebo 1.2 tomorrow and attach it (placing a static sphere in the air with a contact sensor attached to its geometry and have another sphere fall on top of it should reproduce the bug if it is still present. The shapes will collide shortly and the contact sensor will still have the contact stored until it collides with another object).
